comments.body: Why is this not a thing yet

With the Icicle you can make a new block that is semi transparent called Clumped ice made by some Icicles, and 1 powder snow, and a normal ice block. there is different variation of these like Instead of it being chised it is called carved so for example. Carved Clumped ice block, or Carved sliced Clumped ice block. because another variation of it is called sliced which is basically a rename of the word cut.
Please
Would be interesting if items placed in it were trashed so it's an inside the inventory trash can
I'm pretty sure you can literally enchant any item with curse of vanishing, and it actually works (using commands/creative mode).
i saw a post saying how it should be a new trunk that would be green wood.
I've been thinking about this the whole time...so disappointing, I hope it's fixed!
swamp trees
Reduce the variety of items I can put on because at the moment it feels a little too strong, and then maybe I’ll vote for it.
Likee in frozen XD

This is an amazing idea! With time, I’m sure this will get plenty of votes. The rivers could flow through the middle of mountains, carving a tunnel mirroring real life erosion, or on the mountain with lush wildlife surrounding it.
Good idea i sorport it maybe even ading waterfalls in mountains
To make this work, recess the water with steep banks around the edge of the river so the water mechanics don’t create out of control flows covering half the mountain.
Can you put this in Minecraft right now please?
The axolotl will basically have a chance to get the star power-up if this is added
Yes but pastel rainbow it will be more cute
Yes I love then THEY NEED MORE STUFF!!!
I really want this sooooooooooooooooooooooooo bad majang
Amazing Idea! This needs more attention!
When it come?
Iceologer lost the vote. Suggesting it again isn't going to get it in the game any sooner, unfortunately.
I don't know about copper armor, but I agree copper tools is 100% logical for the game.
Copper's weathering doesn't eat through it like rust on iron, though.
It works differently than rust on iron but, it still corrodes

This would be great for survival building projects where you have to dig a ton in a short amount of time;

the tools could also be made from copper alloys to better balance it, requiring 3 copper blocks and 6 ingots of gold/iron in order to get faster/longer-lasting tools
This would be great for copper roofs!
I accually posted a similar idea to this, happy to see many people also think that strongholds should be updated
I actually planned to make a post like this. I made a resource pack and everything, but it just didn't work.
If they added a way to affect the color we could have toggleable particle effects in a single room. This would be incredible for puzzlemakers and certain kinds of builds.
Wait so the ceramic arheolgy is going to be in the actual game, thought its gonna be one of these custom mods from be's market place or smth

I would like to add to that. Having glowing patterns should make the finished pot a light source, the more glow fragments, the brighter the glow. Having pots of different light levels would make tombs and ruins in creative and adventure maps look really good.
idk how this would work since horse armor doesn’t have boots but i like it!

I don't nececaraly think a new ore is needed if they add new uses to copper, but what would be REALLY cool is adding new geodes and crystals, which would add some real fun to discovering those kinds of things.
I would recommend withe ruby or cobalt as a new bluestone version of redstone to make more unique redstone contraptions. And ruby can be used in trading or enchanting somehow
You know what... that makes sense. Maybe an ore from one of the new cave biomes?
Like amethyst? It's pretty rare, and has some very obscure uses.
I agree add more ores like titanium and a lot more Minecraft step up your game literally

Biome specific ores would be really cool. It would certainly add strategy to mining. Imagine if lush caves had a unique ore, similar to how the underground jungle in Terraria has chlorophyte. Perhaps the lush cave could have an ore that is useful in farming somehow. A special ore in the deep dark would be awesome, as you would have to be careful about when you mine it in case there is a warden nearby that might hear you.
new ores don't have to be too unique as long as there will be several or many more new ores. It could be used as a decorative block or what so ever.

I have some suggestions of new ores... The first would be Malachite, found in a Biome called Crystal Caves. Beyond this ore being exclusive to this biome, it would have a higher chance to spawn Amethist Geodes and Lapis Lazuli, like gold in Mesa. The uses to Malachite would be mostly abpout enchanting and more magic in Minecraft. So, it could be used to alter the enchantment shown in the enchantment table,and when you alter it, consumes the Malachite shard.

Another use for it would be combining it with Lapis to make a crystal, called  Magic Crystal, that can make a new set of magic armor and tools, that would give the same protection as iron, the durability of diamond armor and would be more suitable to enchantments, costing only 2 levels to enchant anything that previously costed 3 levels or more. It aslo could be repaired with Malachite and Lapis, it doesn´t need to be the formed crystal.

One final use would be for a Magic Block, also made with Malachite and Lapis, that when put under an Enchanting table would reduce the amount of bookshelfs needed to get lvl 30 by a third. It would also make the table give light level of 14 on a 20 block radius.

yeah rubies would be a good idea it could be used for magic items

i definity think they should add more ores since the whole update is based on improving mining

Your logic confuses me. You say that we are getting one new ore with really obscure uses, so your solution is to add more ores that will likely have even more obscure uses? The cave update has become more than just adding more ores, and i'm glad they did that because it makes it unique. If we add more ores, unless they have a unique, non-decorative use, this game will become too mod-like. Want more ores? Get a mod for it, that's the whole point of mods to begin with. Don't ruin the vanilla game by adding more ores.
I think an XP ore that drops lots of XP when mined would be great. Looks like stone but with green orbs in it.

The only other ore I have ever supported adding to the game is tin, and that's because 100 people were literally spamming me to include tin in my bronze post. After that, I gave it 6-7 uses so it wouldn't become insignificant like copper. 

404559742051 I couldn't possibly disagree with you more. 

new ores don't have to be too unique as long as there will be several or many more new ores.

No.

First, Mojang added copper. Even the guy who made this post agrees copper is terrible. And if the one ore that Mojang added is being criticized by so many people, how do you think they would react to an ore that can only "could be used as a decorative block or what so ever." Like what? Topaz? Sapphire? There are literally no builds where you can put these in and make them look good. Metal is a different story, which is why I decided to add tin, but we already have iron, netherite, tin, how many shades of gray can we have before it starts getting overwhelming?

I will only ever support adding new ores if A: someone convinces me they are special enough to add to the game, something that has only ever been done once in the case of Tin, or B: A new dimension is added. If we ever add the sky dimension or an Aether-type one, sure, bring on your Aether Platinum ore. The overworld doesnt need many more ores.

Rubies as a secondary emerald would add nothing. "Bluestone" has been rejected for a reason. The only reason anyone has ever asked for Topaz is because it would "look cool."

NO MORE GEMS!
I would add a oil ore to power things.

Vegetation can change over millions of years, it is very unlikely that there is the same amount of plants than millions of years ago which basically means that your argumentation kind of makes no sense, but I like the idea anyways.
How about make it too where all the different biomes are more likely than others too get certain ores
This idea is cool, I like it

Maybe instead of maps, he may sell compasses, that would lead you to these biomes? It would work like lodestone, but there won't be phisical object, that compass points, but nearest biome? Or sometimes not even nearest, because that may add some fun - > you will travel more.

Whenever a player is in the corner or edges of a map it shows them as a white dot. I would propose that this is not the case. Having it point where you are facing would make map navigation so much easier
I think it should be for jungle and woodlands because those are valuable
If the new Villager rebalance becomes a thing (where different biomes have different trades) this will become even more valuable!
Interesting idea, I’d definitely like to see more copper variants of existing items like this with unique traits
It  would be make very compact T flip flops, though I don't really see any use beyond. I like the idea of the copper door being "Lockable" with redstone much more.
You should put this in the snapshot category so more people can see this.

I think it would be a bit excessive to actually punish players for killing it. A way to keep the intended gameplay intact while giving the players a means to defeat it and a reward for doing so would be to make the Wardens themselves immune to damage and instead spawn a "warden heart" block for each which they patrol around. You would have to sneak around the warden to search for their heart, which when destroyed would kill/disable the Warden, while also giving you the reward of the heart itself.

Looking to the idea again I think the effects mentioned could be a little too much but the idea remains. Possibly the effects could be depending on difficulty.
The Warden heart idea I also think is tempting, but then you must think why should a player look for the heart and kill it other than just killing the beast. Doesnt this contradict the idea of "we dont want the player to kill the warden"?
Then again my idea around the "How did we get here?" achievement should not be added.
Here's another idea about the Warden heart, what if it simply stuns the Warden?
Ok. Ok. Ok.
I really like the idea, but there would be bugs, that someone can make efficiency 6 without Deep Dark. Or, it is well programmed, without any bugs and mistakes, that would be great!
